title: Keen on PSP
content:
Now that i haxed my PSP, i wonder...

All the emulators for Amiga and the Nintendo systems sure offers alot of fun games to play through, but nothing would beat the feeling of playing Commander Keen on the portable [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]


Does anyone know if there's some way to get the Keen games working?
I looked through DOSbox forum and they said that DOSbox would suck too much power for the emulation to work properly on a PSP... Probably the reason why DOSbox hasn't been ported to PSP i guess. Sad thing when you think about all the great old PC games out there.

It would be kickass to play Keen on PSP though i guess everyone agrees on that point [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-foot.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen on PSP
content: Well, someone could always port [url=http://clonekeen.sourceforge.net/]CloneKeen[/url] to the PSP. John Romero apparently plans to release the source to all the Keen games at some point, and if he does then those could also be ported.

title: Re: Keen on PSP
content:
It'd be cool if there'd be a program that could convert the DOS binary to whatever binary the PSP uses. But I guess that kind of programs would be very difficult to make, as there are many things that likely couldn't be converted very easily. But that'd be about the only way, currently.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen on PSP
content: and always if you got homebrew games on psp you need firmware 2.80 or less i through.

title: Re: Keen on PSP
content:
Underage is when you are too young to do something. For example, you must be 18 or over to drink alcohol where I live - anyone who is less than 18 is known as "underage".

(FUN FACT: online forums are a great way of learning English [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] )

title: Re: Keen on PSP
content:
[hr]KeenRush Hmmm, what is this thing? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]
[hr]It's a PSP port of CloneKeen, the remake that was released early last year or so, that has a few small issues that keeps it from being a full replica of the original games.
[hr]Description Commander Keen PSP is a ported version of Katys CloneKeen v8.3, which is an open-source remake of the good old 2D Commander Keen by id Software back in 1990.
[hr]

title: Re: Keen on PSP
content:
The thing is Niborius, when you install HEN on your PSP you must have a clean installation of the 1.50 firmware.
The later firmware you have installed the more hard it gets to downgrade to 1.50 (sony terminates all known ways to downgrade by presenting new firmware versions to install)

I used an expoit in an old version of Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories that let you downgrade from 2.8-something to 1.50.

But the procedure on how to install the HEN firmware is available on the links i posted earlier [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img]

And yes Galaxieretter, i got it to work nicely.
Maybe i will post a photo of the miracle sometime soon.

title: Re: Keen on PSP
content: but you sad i don't need to downgrade but i can use HEN so i can keep my firmware 3.40![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen on PSP
content:
Yeah but you have to start from 1.5 (if nothing else has come up lately that lets you install HEN from later firmware than 1.5)

If you have an original firmware that is later then 1.5 you need to downgrade first. How you do this depends on what firmware you currently have and if you have certain games that could be exploited to load tools that lets you downgrade.
It's tricky i know! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img]

If you allready have the original 3.40 firmware installed i don't think it's possible for you to downgrade (yet). Hopefully somtime in the near future, someone will find a way to crack the firmware for you.

title: Keen on PSP
content:
You can play Keen 4, 5 6, and Keys of Krodacia on PSP using the PSP port of DOSBOX. They all play fairly well - the speed is fine for the most part, though you must have SVGA fix enabled and I prefer to leave the music off since it stutters due to occasional slowdown. Keen Dreams isn't playable because there's no SVGA fix and without it the screen flickers black. I'll make some videos of it if I have time, I've got all of the games on my PSP (3.40 OE-A) right now.

Not Keen Related: Monster Bash plays fine, but the graphics are odd (it's still good enough to play, just the color is off[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ). Cosmo is really slow. Epic Pinball is fine but you can't see the bar with your scores. Tristan Pinball don't work[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img] . Crystal Caves runs but I can't get the controls working in the game.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img]

title: Keen on PSP
content: No, there's a lot of compatibility issues and settings changes (I think I'm using 1000 or 1500 cycles). Pretty much only things that are very old will even be close to playable.
